direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our room. I don't want to see him and he's not going to come knocking on your door. Simon struggles with his shirt -- she helps him, inadvertently venting some anger as she does so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you not be violent?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think so. You need help with the pants?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to take a big bath and order a big meal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-huh... CAROL I'm sorry... are you okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, considering everything's horrible and tomorrow I have to face my parents... Don't ask me ... I'm sick of my own complaints ... got to get me a new set of thoughts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why? What have you been thinking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How to die, mostly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you believe in our little mix you're the good roommate. Simon laughs -- as she crosses to the bathroom and begins to prepare a bath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good night. We are ON Simon settling in for sleep, when instinct or sounds or the faint glow of hope turns him so that he faces the bathroom and we have... SIMON'S POV Carol sitting at tub's edge -- a towel around her and now as Simon looks at the bathing beauty she adjusts her hair -- the towel falls -- a better than perfect breast exposed... BACK TO SCENE SIMON (a whisper) Hold it. He leaves the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S ON HOTEL DESK What's he up to... he takes the blotter from the desk set and a pen from his jacket pocket which hangs on the chair and with vigor and faint pain moves to the other side of the bed where he turns on the light and stares at Carol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got to sketch you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... Absolutely not. I'm shyer than you think. I give the wrong impression sometimes and... SIMON I haven't even been thinking about sketching for weeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop staring. Do a vase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you're beautiful... your skin glows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. But I just want to take a bath and... SIMON That long neck -- the line of you... you're porcelain... your back goes on forever. You're classic... you're why cavemen chiseled on walls... CAROL All right, cut me a break. Simon's pen moves across the blotter -- Carol sees him earnestly engrossed, a beat of indecision and then shyly but deliberately she lowers the towel. He's right. She's breathtaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Melvin sits alone, nursing a drink. He's been talking to the bartender.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So then, the next thing I know, she's sitting right next to me, and then, well, it's not right to go into the details, but I screwed up. I got nervous. I said the wrong thing and if I hadn't, I could be in bed now with a woman who if you could make her smile you got a life. Instead, I'm here with you, no offense, a moron pushing the last legal drug. He sits there, just another Joe on a bar stool with his heart breaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's excited -- smiling... We hear Carol -- also revved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care how you put it -- We're being naughty here, pal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carol holding a pose for Simon... He is holding a ballpoint over the back of a hotel desk blotter. His style cramped by his cast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. No. This is great, this is so great. I can't get the angle with this cast. He struggles with the cast, and then decides to struggle no more. Summoning remarkable strength, he rips a piece from the cast, freeing his hand -- he roars ironically -- a lion's roar of liberation. He is back at his center.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Melvin is having a room service breakfast. The door opens... Simon enters. A new Simon -- better than ever, clearly happy -- a morning-after glow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you have sex with her? Carol follows his out. Her arms are filled with the hotel soaps, shampoos, etc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, didn't realize she was right there. (a beat) Did you have sex with her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To hell with sex. Carol looks at Melvin -- he can't meet her gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We held each other. It was better than sex. What I need he gave me great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just love her. (beat) How're you doing? Melvin reacts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Simon finishes dialing the phone... a brief wait, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, hi, Mom -- I can barely hear you. Do you have to whisper? No -- don't apologize -- it was the luckiest thing for all of us that you didn't answer last night... I can't hear you... okay, dear, just listen to me then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Melvin has been reduced to straight talk as Carol brings the bathroom bounty into the room and begins to put it in her suitcase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I get why you're angry. It's no snap to explain why I was like that, but let's not try to do it on the run... SIMON ... so Mom. Truly no grudges -- truly. A little odd that you didn't come to see me when you heard I was hurt, but the important thing I want you to know is your son is happy. I'm working again. I'll make do -- I don't want a thing. Wouldn't take it if it was offered. I'll drop you a note from wherever I land and then it's up to you. I hope we patch things up but know that if we don't, I wish you both the very best... I can't hear you. You heard me, though, right? Good -- take good care. 'Bye. He hangs up, totally satisfied with himself and rips over to Carol and Melvin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Now he's going to want to stay. And they'll want to take a ride to the lake or whatever. So it's a good five hours back. It gives us a chance to take it easy and... SIMON I'm going back with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what about... SIMON I'll take care of myself -- MELVIN What are you talking about? You got real problems.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. I'm a little bit nervous. Suddenly everything seems so easy. Carol, a load has been lifted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One night with me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think you're kidding. Melvin stalks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The car parked near a phone booth -- MELVIN (to Frank over the phone) Aww Jesus! No choice. Carol walks up to Simon in the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got a gift for you. She hands him a base ball cap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing like no choice to make you feel at home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me see... Ahh, gorgeous!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do it then. Get the dog picked up. I can't believe you let it stay there. Melvin hangs up the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good-bye. (to Simon) Well, your luck is holding. They sublet your place. You're homeless. Frank's got a line on another place you can use for now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another place where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does it matter? Melvin gets in -- goes to the glove compartment for a special CD labelled "For Emergency Use Only." As it PLAYS a confessional love SONGS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to hear that music right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean? You said you liked it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This one has a special meaning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's your car but I don't want to hear it. If that means anything. Melvin hesitates and then turns OFF the SONG in mid- proclamation of love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the car arrives... They get out... MELVIN Here are the keys to my apartment. I'm going to park you in my place while I take Carol home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll take a bus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll take you... why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care what you did for me. I don't think I want to know you anymore -- all you do is make me feel badly about myself. (turning to Simon) You have my number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you... (sotto) Let him take you home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't want to. I love you. She shakes her head and walks off. Simon looking at Melvin with some sympathy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't say anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where Verdell's ears prick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you to go on in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I've got to get a hold of Frank and see where I'm hanging my hat 'cause... The door opens, revealing them:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you gotta camp it here... SIMON What are you talking about? The dog vaults toward them -- all else forgotten as the dog greets his two favorite people and they talk to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know the feeling -- you feel like your ol' self again, huh? -- Mommy and Daddy are home. Melvin reacts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry... You're fun to mess with. Melvin gets up... Simon notices some of his paintings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They took your place furnished. Jackie said she grabbed your personal stuff -- they were supposed to set you up here. (leading the way) There's this extra room -- I never use. It gets good light. No other answer really. Simon follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they enter... the room clean and organized -- a small but lovely garret.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Melvin. You overwhelm me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They did a nice job... Cozy, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you. Melvin looks at him finally -- pretensions fall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell you, buddy, I'd be the luckiest guy alive if that did it for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Carol unpacks, she gives gifts to her mother and Spencer. But clearly something gnaws at her psyche.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Melvin's two digital clocks are two minutes apart... each around 1:55 a.m... He sits in a chair still fully dressed... forlorn... Verdell in his lap. A beat then we hear Simon's whispered voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is my big hairy boy? Melvin is alarmed. He stops breathing as his gay houseguest approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Verdell, sweeties? Melvin breathes again. Simon enters the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, didn't know you were awake. I just thought Verdell shouldn't get too used to sleeping in here 'cause then... MELVIN Look, we both want the dog -- and... The PHONE RINGS... they look at each other. Melvin doesn't move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should I get it? Melvin nods. Simon walks into the next room... several beats as he finds the phone. We hear him pick it up and:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into phone) Hello. It's me. He took me in. Did you know? Hold on, I'll get him for you. He walks back to Melvin's room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Carol. Melvin is quickly out of his chair -- the dog in one mitt... he thrusts it at Simon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here. Take the dog. As he speeds him out... SIMON Good luck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Melvin picks up the phone... He clears his throat loudly. Following is INTERCUT between Carol and Melvin -- the first such CUT showing Carol blasted by the throat clearing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... Well... MELVIN (very concerned) How you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can trust my brain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That seems like a good choice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know whether I'm being sensible or hard on you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two might go together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See. There's an example. I don't know whether you're being cute or crazy now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have to answer everything I say. Just listen to me. Okay? He nods his head, "yes."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's really something that you're looking after Simon. And what I said on the street. That was a bad thing to say. And it made me sick to my stomach. It was a bad thing to say. And I'd be lying if I didn't say that I enjoyed your company... but the truth is you do bother me enormously and I know -- think -- that it's best for me to not have contact with you because you're just not ready and you're a pretty old guy to not be ready... and I'm too old to ignore that. But there were extraordinary kindnesses that did take place. So thanks for the trips... She's just broken up with him but she's being nicer than ever. It's hard to know whether to die or not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay to say something now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should've danced with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Good-bye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So long. Carol hangs up. She feels strange. A shoe hasn't dropped. Oh, hell... she missed him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Melvin walks in anxious circles in the living room. He is impatient.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You going to come talk to me or not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm coming. We enters the room carrying Verdell who strains to be allowed closer to Melvin. Simon releases him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did she say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a great guy -- "extraordinary"... (before Simon can celebrate) ... and she doesn't want contact with me. (a beat) I'm dying here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because... (gently) ... you love her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... and you're supposed to be sensitive and sharp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay... you tell me why -- (mimics him) "You're dying here."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know... Let me sleep on it and figure it out. (then) Because I'm stuck! Can't go back to what I had... She's evicted me from my life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you like it that much?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was better than this... Look, you, I'm very intelligent. If you're going to give me advice or conversation or consolation or hope, you got to be better than you're doing. If you can't be at least momentarily interesting than shut the hell up. I'm drowning and you're describing water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picking on me won't help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, if that's true then I'm really in trouble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you know where you're lucky?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know who you want. I'll take your seat any day. So do something... don't sleep on it... go over there. I don't think anybody should ever sleep on anything -- it's not always good to let things calm down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey... I'm charged here. But she might kill me for showing up this late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then get in your jammies and I'll read you a story... I think you've got a chance. The only real enemy you have is her ability to think logically -- the best thing you have going for you is your willingness to humiliate yourself if it gives you one chance in whatever -- so go catch her off- guard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Thanks a lot. Here I go. He moves for the door... stops suddenly, jolted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I forgot to lock the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he parks. He exits the car -- now wary... looks at his watch... hesitates... walks reluctantly into the apartment house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Melvin looks at Carol's doorbell with great uncertainty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carol in a cotton wrap-around dress/bathrobe... sitting directly in front of a fan... the windows open, reading one of Melvin's books... There is the briefest possible sound of a DOORBELL... someone has jabbed her downstairs button ever so briefly -- so briefly that she's not certain it's her DOORBELL -- until the same brief sound REPEATED... She walks to her wide open window and looks over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The convertible at the curb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hesitates -- INT. CAROL'S APARTMENT BUILDING - VESTIBULE - NIGHT As Melvin gives up and starts out... turning as the sudden blast of being BUZZED into Carol's life sounds. He bolts for the door and enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She opens the door... she hears the sound of MELVIN SOUNDING HEAVILY up the stairs... He reaches her side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want, Melvin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were you asleep?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Cause if you were asleep -- I'm sorry. And you could be grouchy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grouchy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... 'Cause of being woken up, and it would make my job impossible. So then I wouldn't even try.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What job?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were you asleep?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beverly in the hallway looking on -- BACK TO SCENE MELVIN I'm sorry I woke you -- some other time. He half turns to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wasn't asleep!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a break... CAROL (losing it a bit) Is it a secret what you're doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had to see you... CAROL Because... MELVIN It relaxes me... I'd feel better just sitting on the curb in front of your house than anyplace else I can think of or imagine. Carol has not ever heard anything like that before... it's sort of sexy in its sincerity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As we see in the b.g. that Beverly, standing near her door down the hallway, has heard at least this last part... Melvin, of course, cannot leave well enough alone... MELVIN (serious) Wait a minute, I'm overstating here, maybe the inside stairs. I don't want to sit with my feet in the gutter. What does that serve? It only... But suddenly Carl is shouting to the heavens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it!! Why can't I have a normal boyfriend??? Why? Get out of here. Just a regular boyfriend who doesn't go nuts on me... BEVERLY (butting in) Everybody wants that, dear -- it doesn't exit... (as Carol turns to her) Sorry... didn't mean to interrupt. She disappears into her room. Carol snorts a laugh -- gathers herself. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boyfriend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, come on in and try not to ruin everything by being you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we could live without the wise cracks. She looks at him -- then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we could... Melvin glances at the cracked pattern of Carol's kitchen linoleum and stalls at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It feels a little confined here. Let's take a walk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See. It's four in the morning. A walk sounds a little screwy to me, if you don't mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you need an excuse, there's a bakery on the corner. There's a shot it'll open soon -- that way we're not screwy -- we're just two people who like warm rolls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They walk quietly -- Melvin still walking with his usual attention to where he steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Melvin walking -- and though we can see an improvement -- it is still decidedly strange as he conspicuously avoids stepping on the lines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carol sighs. It is the sound of possibilities crashing down. Melvin looks at her -- embarrassed, self-conscious -- his habits making him appear unworthy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, Melvin -- but whatever this is -- is not going to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes this hard. It forces him to half-whisper something he hasn't at all said to himself... given his history... this is an extraordinary intimacy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm feeling... I've been feeling better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Melvin, even though it may seem that way now -- you don't know me all that well... (as he scoffs) I'm not the answer for you. She starts to turn. He tugs at her arm. As she turns back to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, I've got a great compliment for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what? I... MELVIN Just let me talk. (gathers himself with uncertainty, then:) I'm the only one on the face of the earth who realizes that you're the greatest woman on earth. I'm the only one who appreciates how amazing you are in every single thing you do -- in every single thought you have... in how you are with Spencer -- Spence... (he has reached her) ... in how you say what you mean and how you almost always mean something that's all about being straight and good... ON CAROL She stands on the precipice of being transported away from the logic which has been her lifeline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think most people miss that about you and I watch wondering how they can watch you bring them food and clear their dishes and never get that they have just met the greatest woman alive... And the fact that I get it makes me feel great... about me! (a real question filled with concern for her) You got a real good reason to walk out on that? That last question clearly a true question, not the least rhetorical -- she considers her answer, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! It's certainly not. No -- I don't think so. No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna grab you. (with conviction) I didn't mean it to be a question. I'm gonna grab you. He kisses her. An awkward bomb of a kiss. They separate. A tense beat. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know I can do better. They embrace again. He does indeed do much better. A first-class smooch. CAMERA MOVES DOWN to see his foot land squarely on a crack in the sidewalk without his knowledge. They break -- look at each other without a notion of where to take it from here, and the ALMOST in unison begin to walk away FROM CAMERA, Melvin following a path that avoids cracks. Suddenly the lights of the bakery turn on as it opens for business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Warm rolls... They walk to the bakery, Melvin avoiding the cracks. As they enter the bakery, a WORKER moves toward them to clean the entranceway. Melvin, forced to step back onto a crack, this time notices -- registers the momentous fact and joins Carol inside as we:
direction.name: direction
